stadium.name: The Prismatic Pavilion
stadium.description: A massive, permanent, open-air fairground pavilion built on stilts over the Starlight Lagoon. The field is a chaotic mix of colorful stage-planks, constantly surrounded by the Prismatic Troupe's performers.

stats.pregame_ritual: Sticking a specific type of feather in their helmet's plume.
Jogging three laps around the perimeter of the field.
Getting a teammate to punch them in the shoulder, hard.
Tracing an invisible, complex sigil over their heart.
Performing a series of aggressive, theatrical poses.
Leading the team in a synchronized chant that slowly gets louder.
Staring at their reflection in a bucket of water until they feel 'ready'.
Telling a terrible joke to the Trollball to 'loosen it up'.
Staring intently at their gauntlets, as if for the first time.
Plucking a single hair from a teammate's beard for luck.
Trying to start a 'slow clap' with the audience before the game has begun.

stadium.name: Fletchings Field
stadium.description: Fletchings Field was the first formal Troll Ball stadium in Warden lands. The design balances wood and stone, with arrowhead motifs and banners representing each region under Warden protection. The field includes trees, gully's and other obstacle placements, changed each match by local druids and terrain crafters.

stats.pregame_ritual: Going over the game plan drawn in the dirt with the team captain.
Leading the team in a synchronized chant that slowly gets louder.
Wearing their boots on the wrong feet during the warm-up.
Wearing their boots on the wrong feet during the warm-up.
Giving the Trollball a heroic backstory before each game.
Headbutting their own team's goal post (gently).
Sticking a specific type of feather in their helmet's plume.
Burying their helmet in the ground and then digging it back up.
Reading their own fortune in a scattering of knuckle bones.
Wearing a specific, garishly colored pair of undergarments.
Always putting on their left gauntlet before their right.

preGame: Greetings, ghouls, ghosts, and gladiators! This is Nok the Corrupter coming to you live from the Prismatic Pavilion! It‚Äôs the final week of the regular season, and the atmosphere is thicker than a swamp hag's stew! We‚Äôre perched right over the Starlight Lagoon, and I tell you, the footing is as shaky as a hero‚Äôs moral compass! üåä The Oak & Onslaught have arrived, and they are looking to pulverize! I saw Normi Glaudia and Wynnie Faina warming up with their boots on the wrong feet‚Äînow that‚Äôs the kind of chaotic energy I love to see! Meanwhile, Symer Crissy is whispering sweet heroics to the trollhead, giving it a backstory before she uses it to bash some skulls! üèüÔ∏è On the home side, the Starlight Bazaar Bizarres are putting on quite the show! Quintessa Austine is out there trying to get a slow clap going with a crowd that‚Äôs mostly here to see the Wardens‚Äô favorites get flattened! Kristin Kronfeld is getting punched in the shoulder by her teammates, and Pompei Hephzipa is striking poses that would make a gargoyle blush! It‚Äôs a real sell-out crowd for the Onslaught, while the Bizarres‚Äô section looks a bit like a graveyard at midnight‚Äîquiet and empty! Let‚Äôs get to the carnage! üõ°Ô∏èüí•
postGame:
What a crackerjack of an afternoon of absolute mayhem! The Prismatic Pavilion nearly collapsed under the weight of all that beautiful violence! The Bizarres started things off with a bang when Willa Lois took a shot from center field and sent that trollhead sailing right through the hoop for two points! üéØ It looked like the flashy performers of the circus had the upper hand, but the Onslaught isn't a team that stays down for long! The violence really ramped up when Willa Lois absolutely crunched Abner Seidel, sending him to the healer with a nasty injury! üöë And just to keep the blood flowing, Gagliano Tallbott took out Wynnie Faina right before the break! But don't you worry, fans, Ema Ulrick was there to clean up the mess, dunking the ball twice in the first half to keep the Onslaught in the hunt! ü©∏ 

Halftime saw everyone get patched up by the healers, including Ahron Latashia who I‚Äôm sure was just drawing more circles in the dirt! When we came back, it was the Millham Evangeline show! Millham stepped up to center field and hammered home a two-point shoot that had the crowd roaring! üì£ The Bizarres tried to make a comeback when Melesa Zelten danced through the defense for a dunk, but the shifting terrain of this pavilion is a cruel mistress! I saw Gagliano Tallbott running like the wind, only for the defense to shut him down! üé≠ The drama peaked when Wynnie Faina got some revenge, tackling Aggri Cookie so hard I think I saw a few teeth fly into the lagoon! ü¶∑ Millham Evangeline wasn't finished, though, sinking another magnificent two-point shot from Away 2-Point to put the nail in the coffin! Final score: Oak & Onslaught 6, Starlight Bazaar Bizarres 3! üèÜ 

A dominant victory for the Warden‚Äôs finest, even if Sir Randy‚Äôs presence in the stands makes my skin crawl! I‚Äôd much rather be watching my Ebon Gate Corruptors tear the Haven Lights limb from limb, but this was a decent substitute for a Tuesday night! The Bizarres might have the flair, but today they just had the floor‚Äîmostly because they were being pinned to it by a mallet or a blackjack! The crowd for the Onslaught is absolutely electric tonight, cheering every broken bone like it was a gold coin! It‚Äôs a shame the Bizarres couldn't find their footing on these unstable planks, but that's Trollball for you‚Äîone minute you're posing, the next you're floating in the lagoon! This is Nok the Corrupter, signing off from the most beautiful bloodbath in Osterra! See you at the playoffs, if you survive the night! üòàüî•
